# install postgres yum --enablerepo base update openssl yum install postgresql91 yum install postgresql91-devel yum install postgresql91-server yum install postgresql91-jdbc yum --enablerepo base install unixODBC yum install postgresql91-odbc yum install postgresql91-docs yum install postgresql91-python #yum install postgresql91-plpython #yum install postgresql91-pltcl yum --enablerepo=base install uuid yum install postgresql91-contrib yum install postgresql91-libs yum install postgresql91-test yum install pgbouncer
# install postgis export PATH=/usr/pgsql-9.1/bin:$PATH yum --enablerepo epel install json-c.x86_64
# this installs proj and geos rpms yum install postgis2_91
# set mode to strict (2) to prevent postgres being killed by OOM /sbin/sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=2
# Postgres (for lifemapper) # Set overcommit_memory mode to strict to reduce chances of OOM killer invocation vm.overcommit_memory = 2
# create unix socket dir for postgres and pgbounser mkdir -p /var/run/postgresql chown postgres:postgres /var/run/postgresql
# add unix socket info for postgres user
PGHOST=/var/run/postgresql export PGHOST
/opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/lmserver_init
# start postgres PG=`basename /etc/init.d/postgresql-*` /sbin/chkconfig $PG on /sbin/chkconfig --add $PG /sbin/service $PG initdb /sbin/service $PG start
#/sbin/chkconfig mysqld on
# start pgbouncer BOUNCER=/etc/init.d/pgbouncer /sbin/chkconfig $BOUNCER on /sbin/chkconfig --add $BOUNCER /sbin/service $BOUNCER start
# may need this later for postgres tuning # rocks set network mtu public 9000 # rocks sync host network `hostname -s`
